Food was delicious! Crystal (and only crystal) was a great server! We ordered a huge selection and enjoyed almost everything, a few dishes could have been a little more spicy but the flavors were still great. Thanks for making my first Indian meal a delicious one.

My first time here. I was actually on my way to a different Indian restaurant and saw this one along the way thought I'd give it a try since I'd never been here. Anyway food was good the staff was friendly. I got a lot of containers for my buffet to go :) they had quite a bit of vegetarian options and some vegan. My craving is satisfied!
Good value for your buck. Very close to the strip.
Awesome food as always... Buffet is really good and have plenty of choices.. Thanks aj

Delightful lunch buffet with many options. Don't let the plain exterior fool you; the interior is gorgeous with high ceilings, mood lighting and lovely colors. Naan is delivered to the table; choices on the table the day we visited included many sauces, many vegetarian dishes, oranges, pakora (yum!), two options that included paneer, and three different chicken options. I thought it was delicious and appreciated the variety of flavors.

This place was on a recent episode of dirty dining. Currently under revocation by the Health District of Nevada for varios infractions of pest infestation meaning multiple generations of roaches. This was an episode from Fox 5 on March 3rd.

We've been going here for years and today was very likely the last time, sad to say. The parking lot was surprisingly empty and I guess we now know why. My wife normally loves the tandori chicken but today it was EXTREMELY dry and unedible. We told our waiter about it and he takes the piece of dry chicken from our table and takes it to the back kitchen and seemed to tell the cook that the chicken was bad. Well, no follow up, no apology and he seemed to laugh it off with the female waitress that seemed to be flipping the dry pieces, just picking at them. I've kind of noticed the food was getting lower in quality lately, but didn't say much since it was my wife's favorite Indian lunch buffet. Even the solidly prepared mango lassi was full of ice pieces, didn't taste good and didn't arrive to the table until my plate was nearly finished. I didn't even go for seconds, since there really wasn't anything worth going back for. We have other choices for Indian food and next time it won't be here. Maybe they changed owners?

Overall, I thought this place was fine. I liked the decor, and the high ceilings. I liked the food. The bathroom was clean and nice.  I don't know, man..... I just don't really know what else to say. This place was just average I guess. I was there for the lunch buffet and to repeat Misti Y., it did seem like for what they offered combined with freshness level, it was a tad pricey. I did think the food tasted really good, and I liked the vegetarian dishes and both dessert options. They had a carrot/raisin pudding and a sweet rice noodle/coconut pudding. Mixed together, it was so friggin' GOOD!   Now here's the major bummer. One of my favorite things is Indian "Nan" bread. I was NOT feein' this place's nan (at least, not on the buffet). It's supposed to be somewhat fluffy and soft. This place's nan seemed like it had sat out too long or something, because it was flat and pretty hard in places. It was disappointing, because it is meant to be ripped up and used to scoop up the yummy rice and curry mix with your hands. I couldn't even rip off a piece anywhere without getting a hard, unbend-able hunk of bread.  I was recommended to try the Kingfisher beer, which apparently is a popular beer consumed in India. It's a light beer, but has a bitter, hoppy kick to it.. Unfortunately, I had to flag down a waiter just to order it.  They sat us down, and just left. My mom wanted to go up and get a plate immediately, but I told her to wait a few minutes because at a buffet, they are supposed to come over and ask what you want to drink. No one ever came. We just sat there staring at each other for five minutes while waiting for someone to stop by the table, to no avail. Kinda odd.  Maybe I will come back for dinner, but I feel like I could find an Indian restaurant just as good (if not better) for less money. For two lunch buffets and a beer, the bill was like $34! Holy S*IT!   One positive: If you go on their website, you can print out a 15% coupon! You will need it with those prices.

Beware!  We have come here a couple of times and found that food was great, but lately management must of change or something... There's several things that were not right.  Behind the seating booths there's dust as if hasn't been clean for months, but the worst part was after finding the second piece of hair in my food, my entire family and I had to leave of how disgusted we were

This is the best India buffet I've been to. I come every time I hit Vegas. They simply have the best spread with the best flavors and freshest. I highly recommend this place if you love Indian food. Believe me, we are consumers of Indian buffets and this place rocks.
Over priced buffet may be due to location. Went around 11:30am and buffet was missing veg biryani and idli. To me food quality and variety do not justify high buffet cost.
The first Indian restaurant in 1993 and still providing excellent service for tourist and locals.

Fantastic food and very attentive service. Some of the best lassis we've had.  The samosas were delicious.  The dal tarka was also amazing.  If we're in Vegas, we'll definitely make time for a meal here
Good Indian place in Las Vegas. Convenient location. I like the atmosphere of this place, really big and cool decor. The food is good. The naan was a little dry.
Dinner buffet is delicious and affordable. The food, oh man, it's good. Real good. It's pretty busy as well, which speaks for how good the food is. Nice selection in the buffet.

Fantastic food and what a pleasure to be served by Christal!! Being in good business for over a decade I will highly recommend this place. Owner actually came down to introduce himself and asked if we were doing well. Tells be a lot about a joint when the owner cares. Authentic food!!
1st time trying India food while on vacation. Food was good but the service was outstanding!  Courteous and attentative!

I went to Gandhi's  while in Vegas with a friend of mine from high school back in July. If you don't know where this place is, chances are you probably won't find it as it is hidden within a strip mall and you would think it was closed down if you didn't know any better.  We were seated immediately as it appeared that my friend knew everyone in the place. Everyone made sure to come over and say hello and to constantly check on us all evening. I actually felt like a celebrity with all the attention we were getting. Anyway enough about that, onto the food.  We ordered the Paneer Pakora which was homemade deep fried cottage cheese, Gosht Vindaloo, and the Chicken Makhanwala along with tons of Nan. I was in Indian food heaven. The lamb was cooked to perfection and the Chicken had a nice blend of spices and the sauce was divine! I am sitting here licking my lips still remembering just how good it was.   This place is a nice little hidden gem that you should really try if you are ever in Vegas. You do realize that it means you will have to explore outside of the strip so venture if you dare :)

This was the best meal I have eaten in ages! The ambiance is fantastic and the service was even better! I am a vegetarian, so I have become accustomed to having limited options when I go out to eat. That is not the case here!! There are so many options I can't wait to come back and try more!

I have to say I have been coming here for years. Unfortunately the last few times I have been here, I ended up having serious stomach aches and feeling sick. Now I know and am disgusted as I have been a loyal customer for years. Learning that they have had serious health violations, I will never eat here again. Shame on the restaurant manager and owner. I would give 0 stars but it will not let me. Never eat here. They have no regard for their customers, especially loyal ones.
This place is so good. Im mexican and I rather have chicken tikka masala than burritod
The service was awesome ! They opened the restaurant earlier just for us, they had a little Chat with us as well ! The food was awesome as well ! Good place ! Felt like India ! Love it
Food was great. Server had very bad attitude. If you don't like doing customer service. Find another job!

A few people from my office regularly patronize this location for lunch, so today I came in to give it a shot. I would have NEVER known this place existed if I didn't work near by because it's hidden in a really run down looking plaza just next to Morton's, but inside it has an awesome hip ambiance, low lighting and swanky Indian music!! I left full and happy! I will be back again for the lunch buffet. I can't handle a lot of heat in my food and to me, this was PERFECT, not too spicy and not bland either, lot's of flavor. I LOVED the fresh baked naan bread (I got plain). I have been to another Indian place in the area that gets higher stars on Yelp and I personally like this place way better! During my visit I noticed a lot of Indian patrons eating as well, I take that as a good sign. I totally recommend.

The buffet was amazing and the service was prompt.  Lamb curry was tender and delicious.  The samosa was the best I have ever had and the mango custard was a perfect finish.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.

I had a very nice buffet here this afternoon! The food was very good, especially the tandoori chicken! Most buffet style tandoori is dry, but this was delicious! I enjoyed the butter chicken with rice, not very spicy so perfect for those of who who can't handle the heat. The veggie pakora had maybe been out too long, they were a little mushy, but still had a good flavor.
Second time here. Awesome food. Will continue coming back next time. Very good mango lassi and chicken tikka masala

Since I am in Vegas, I am enjoying all the buffets. Today I was craving Indian food and decided to visit with my friend. I really enjoyed the lunch buffet. The tandoori chicken was really tender and full of flavor. It was all hot and fresh and really good. A few dishes were a little spicy for me. But the naan was perfect. Customer service wasn't too bad, although they could use a little pep up. Perfect lunch to keep my energy going while we explored the Strip and went to see the fountains. I love Indian food because it sustains my energy for a long time. The place was super nice. I was impressed with how fancy it felt, but the lunch buffet was still an extremely inexpensive amount, especially coming from Hawaii where everything costs an arm and a leg. Thank you for a nice lunch and keep that buffet because I will visit every time I come back!

We ordered take out from Gandi's because it was the closest to our hotel during our stay, and we ordered from the yelp app as well. First- rice is not included with your order. I didn't realize this when ordering, but it would have been nice to know beforehand! We picked up our order, went back to the hotel, and then had to go all the way back to pick up rice so we could eat. What kind of Indian place doesn't give you rice with your entrees? I have never, ever, been to one. The food was only okay. It was decent, and we ate it, but a disappointment overall. I would not come back.
Christal was good is she served very well  And food malai koftha and navrathan kurma with roti was awesome that's y this credit
Awesome vegetarian food especially Malai paneer and Dal tadka. Crystal Harris, our waitress was awesome for suggesting the food and drinks!! Will surely visit again!!

Not worth the hype .. Went there after seeing yelp reviews ... The idly sambar was the worst ! The malai kofta was good .. The rice was not cooked. Not sure if this is the case only today .. Unfortunately it was not a good experience for us

Okay, here is the story. We went here after we saw this restaurant featured in one of the movie. We went there on Monday night for dinner, wasn't crowded. Food was good, but nothing outstanding. Very dark place. Overall, a nice Indian good after some good tired days of walk and fun in Vegas..

Food: 3  Service: 3  Had the Gandhi Thali -- a sampler of vegetarian items. The malai kofta was tasty, but the mattar Paneer was blah and had only one small chunk of cheese. The samosa had a tender crust. For dinner, it would be better to go with a group so you can choose the things to share.   Service was OK but unexceptional. I'd like to go back for lunch to try their buffet.

Lunch buffet is perfect!   I am all about Indian Buffets. The price here is good too.   Went here for lunch with co-workers and had a great time. Plenty to choose from. The potatoes that have spinach in it is amazing. The naan is nothing to write home about, and some other just okay dishes . For sure try the butter chicken.   Best of all it's not too heavy!

A nice, calm & relaxed place off the strip. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Vegas. We were staying in Venetian & were bored of eating Italian food. We tried the lunch buffet here & it had lots of option for Vegetarian & non vegetarian. Food was reasonably priced & tasted good. On another day we tried their Ala crate menu as well & it was also good & well priced. Servers here are extremely friendly & help you out to pick right dishes. Big thumbs up.
Good atmosphere, once you get inside. Knowledgeable/helpful staff. Lamb was tough, but vegetarian picks were good.
Went for the lunch buffet and it was delicious! Liked the vegetarian, vegan and non-vegetarian options.  The chai tea was amazing too!  Returning soon!

We walked inside the restaurant very excited to eat at this famous restaurant for dinner and when we entered inside this seemingly authentic Indian restaurant we found it almost empty with none of the hotel staff anywhere in sight and just a couple of diners sitting in one table. we decided to wait for a couple of minutes to see if anyone from the staff would appear. But no one showed up. After waiting for 5 minutes we decided to leave. It was extremely disappointing that a restaurant with such good reputation would give us such a terrible experience!!!
I go for the buffet. I have no idea what I'm eating but it tastes great.  The service is excellent!

I ate here a long time ago when it was just a vegetarian place, but now I think they got new management, new interior design, and most importantly NEW CHEFS.  I went for lunch buffet and dinner. The buffet was excellent, well flavored. The only flaw is you have to go up to the buffet to get naan.. so everyone was just waiting until they make some, then everyone rushes to it.  Really good food, reasonably priced. But it's not as good as it gets. =) 4 stars.

Good food. I was surprised to find that they charge $4 for rice though... On the side of curry? Doesn't that usually come with it?   And, the waiter told me that I couldn't order one of the curries because I was not Indian. I think he meant it as a warning about the spice but never-the-less I thought it was funny and worth mentioning.   FYI - the wifi password is "iloveganhdi"

Avg and expensive food . We went for dinner.. Aloo tiki was pieces of fried dough , green chutney felt like spolied cilantro smoothie, dal makhani  there was nothing makhani about it just dome boiled lentils , the nan with nuts was so sweet and had only coconut and no nuts  If u tell them what the problem in food they just completely ignore u rather than fix it. So don't go by menu descriptions they just do whatever is convenient to them and use left overs  A big AVOID

When we arrived, the area looked a bit shady and the restaurant looked small. But let me tell you this is one of the best Indian buffet that I've had in a long time. I stayed at Edison, NJ for more than 3yrs and my expectation of Indian food in tge US is really high. I can tell you that this restaurant was right up there in terms of food quality, taste, cost, etc.   Definitely recommend if you're in the vicinity and looking for some Indian food.

Amazing Indian food! Went today for the first time for a friends baby shower and I was pleased with the service, the variety of food and the taste. It wasn't too spicy or under seasoned. The price was also reasonable. The owner stopped to talk to us, which made it an even more satisfying defining experience.
One of my favorite places for Indian food. Their lunch buffet selection is good and all of their food is delicious! Staff is very friendly as well.

The food was superb. The service? Well, it was clear our party was a burden to the server. We weren't told that we'd be charged extra for things like rice and bread, even though the server kept bringing us more. I'm not sure how much each side of rice was, but it was really expensive and they didn't bring us a complimentary portion for our entrees. The portions were tiny. Think Happy Meal tiny. This wouldn't be a problem if the prices weren't so high. All in all, I won't be back, but I'll be looking for another restaurant that has good food, good portions, good prices, and good service. 2 stars just for the food.

Whenever my husband and I come to Vegas, we always eat solely at Las Vegas's best kept secret: Gandhi India's Cuisine.  We've tried other Indian restaurants in Vegas and thought they were just okay.  Gandhi is a cut above.  Everything is so masterfully flavorful, your mouth does a little dance with each bite!  Last time we were there, I discovered the eggplant bhartha which was amazing, also, there's a mushroom dish on the menu that was out of this world--and I'm not even a mushroom lover, I barely even like them!  But the sauce was so yummy and delicious.  The samosas are some of the best we've tasted.  Mango lassi and kulfi are excellent.  Please maintain your reputation by hiring and keeping the best cooks ever.    Also on a side note: please make sure you keep your salt level just right.  I don't eat out much, so sodium can be an issue for me at some Indian restaurants.  The spices, onions, tomatoes, etc., give the perfect taste, not so much salt is needed.  So when in doubt, use a pinch less.
Great great service  Really good food, nice an spicy  Overall great, could not ask for more I will be sure to recommend this place and come back next time I am in Las Vegas.
I love Indian food and this is one of the best I have ever had. Incredible setting and food. Yellow Dal is incredible. Feels great after!!

I was at LV for a convention and ate here. It is without any doubt the best Indian food in this region. The food was authentic. The staff is very accomodating.   They get very busy during dinner. Little early dinner can help beat the crowd.

I've been to Gandhi many time and I've never been disappointed with them either on service or the food.  My favorite is during the lunch buffet, the price is very reasonable and very tasty(even better with 10% off coupon which you can find it on magazine all the time), my Indian neighbor also told me not only they think the food are great, the restaurant never charge their 5 and 4 year old kids, my india friends from CA also loves the food there.  The dinner was a bit more expensive, but well worth it, they have combination dishes that you can get for $16, which include appetizers, 2 course entree, dessert and drinks, I felt just right after I finish it, and the services were good.  Although Origin India has better review, but I've been there just twice and hate their service already(please refer to the one about coupon), trust me, I would rather go to a friendly restaurant where I feel welcome than going to a restaurant with great food but got insulted by the waiters.  here's my review to Origin India, if you want to have great food but in a mood of being insulted, here's the best place to go http://www.yelp.com/biz/origin-india-las-vegas#hrid:lzQO_2nU2Y2CFCXWEZf1rQ
The food is over-the-top delicious. I really enjoyed the lunch buffet. Ate too much, and had to skip desert.
Fantastic food, super fresh and tasty. great atmosphere and the owners are amazing! Will be coming here again when we are in Vegas again. Thank you for fantastic food!!
The food was TERRIFIC! Soooooo, good, I could eat their Nan for the rest of my life. I will definitely go back!  The parking however, is sketchy and I  was quite concerned leaving my car outside.

The service was very poor, the atmosphere very average. Food was good, even though we were not ask if we wanted our food mild so our food was hot flavored. Price was ok till u realize that all food is a la carte. I did not realize rice was extra with your curry, so be sure to get your side otherwise you will disappointed. Overall, I will not come here.
Very good authentic Indian food and great service . We were in Vegas for a convention and stopped here for dinner. It's. Must do Indian restaurant ... When in Vegas .

My husband, daughter and I went to this restaurant today for lunch. It was 2:30 pm and there were approximately 20 people already in the restaurant eating.  When we were waiting to be seated one of the staff members came to tell us they were closing. It's 2:30 in the afternoon why would they be closing early on a Saturday? Also, their website states they close at 11 pm so that was really weird. I had to look down to see the color of my skin to figure out why they were all of a sudden closing so early. But that's okay, I would much rather give my hard earned money to a company that respect and values their customers regardless of  what race they are. I drove about a mile up the street to another restaurant called India Oven Masala. I had no issues there. Their food was great and their service was awesome as well. So I will definitely recommend going to that restaurant instead.

I've never had such a bad experience with Indian food.  The food was serve on a metal tray like the one in prisons, its terrible and it is rediculousy expensive for the qaulity and portion.  Unbelievable!!!  Spend your money elsewhere.
I ate here the other day.. Ilike it. Food was good and so was the service. One of best indian cuisine
Some of the best chicken and curry I have tasted. The chicken especially, is always tender and the perfect texture and flavor at all times. My go to place for indian cuisine.

The food here is Delicious, I'm usually not the one to write reviews but after ages I had such good kebabs that I am now compelled to write a review. The lentils, lamb was of top notch quality, the chicken was extremely juicy and tender, the atmosphere and the decor was very vibrant. the servers and the quality of food was amazing, the owner even stopped by and checked in on us twice just to make sure everything was of amazing quality, simply amazing guy to talk too, very humble and very attentive to your needs. He offered us a sample of kheer (rice pudding) on the house because he just wanted us to try his favorite desert. Will definitely be bringing my friends here.

I went for dinner and ordered the Tandoori chicken, it was very tender and flavorful. The atmosphere is also great. I am on atkins diet lately and I highly recommend their tandoori chicken (one order is more than enough for even two people)

There is a lot of Indian Cuisine competition but this place does have great service and great comfort food at a good price. I really enjoy the neighborhood competition, Mint Indian Bistro and Origin of India more though, but there is something about this place that continues to keep itself standing, despite this. I would definitely go here if I had more friends who like Indian food or ate out as much as I used to. This place is a lot older. But I live right up the street from this place and if I got tired of frequenting Mint Indian Bistro on Flamingo, I would go here to get a change of setting. I think it is a little more authentic than the Mint, but I am not a fan of authentic, I like a little bit of flare to my food that is catered to Americans. My friend likes this place more than Mint, so maybe they have some special dishes that stand out for vegetarians...  Again, because it sits in a terrible neighborhood, the fact that it still survived the many years of recession probably says a lot about the authenticity of their dishes. I don't know a lot about their off the buffet menu entrees but I hear they are pretty good.  The decor has antique wood and has a fine dining appeal with the table cloth and nice water glass. But, this seems to be  a common theme for all of the Indian Restaurants, they are very properly set.  The Indian food buffet is a good deal, but if I had patience I would order off the menu because they will cook it to order and the food will taste fresh and more flavorful.
Delicious food! The service was alright, not bad. But the quality of the food was worth a couple mix ups with our orders. Overall, I'd eat here every time I come to Vegas.
I went to this place as I want to support a reopened restaurant.We are vegetarian.  Service & quality have to be improved. New owner's presence is a must otherwise he may have to close it again.
So I gave this place another chance for dinner and lunch. It was pretty good still not a big fan of the obvious downgrade on the silverware department but the food was much better keep it up :)
This place is absolutely terrible.....blandest tasting Indian food out there and overpriced. Two big thumbs DOWN!

The restaurant is very simple and plain on the outside.  Once you enter, the decor is simple, yet nice.  The atmosphere and music is upbeat.  Service was good and the food here is good, but nothing compared to Baluchi's in New York.  I was there with a group and we ordered mango lassi, a variety of naan, chicken vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, chicken biryani, and more...    The place is worth a try if you are out in Vegas and are willing to explore outside of the strip.
Gandhi is awesome. Please don't take my word for it, go try their fish tikka and fish pakora and I bet you you'll fall in love with it. This comes from a foodie who loves authentic fish!

Came for dinner.  The food was too oily and spicy, even for someone like me who enjoys the heat.  So spicy, I could barely taste the flavor of the food.  Very expensive, and the portions were so large, I felt like I was wasting food because I couldn't finish it.  Even though the place was almost empty, the service was really slow, and it was hard to find the wait staff to get their attention.

The food was AMAZING. We went to a different Indian restaurant down the street that was not good. We decided to try Ghandi as our cravings weren't satisfied w our last meal and couldn't have been happier. Finally found our go to Indian spot in Vegas!

What happened here??  When I was here for dinner a little over a year ago, the buffet (the matter paneer in particular) was fan-flippin-tastic.  Service was great, the food was amazing, and I swore an oath to myself that I would somehow come back here.  I was in Vegas with my fianc√© this past weekend and, even though he's not big on Indian food, I talked him into having dinner here because of how good it was.  Womp Womp.  Did they change ownership??  There's no such thing as a dinner buffet anymore.  "Well, I can't eat embarrassing amounts at the buffet, but at least I can order the matter paneer off the menu," I thought.  There was one nice host/busser, one food runner, and one disinterested waiter, which got to be a problem as the dinner crowd picked up.  The naan was sub-par; more burnt air bubbles than anything.  My beloved matter paneer was totally different.  It wasn't bad.  Actually, it was pretty decent, but nowhere near as good as it used to be.  We sat at the table, done eating, plates cleared, for a loooong time before I was able to practically tackle the waiter to get our check.  Had I never been here before, this would have been a 2.5-rounded-up-to-3-stars-to-be-generous experience.  But knowing what was and what could have been, this mostly left me disappointed and apologizing to my fianc√© for misleading him.

After my second visit, I realized this place is not that great. Steer clear of the buffet. Not worth the price for the few dishes offered and very similar selections to make the buffet appear plentiful!  The food does not taste fresh. It seems like it is mainly leftovers that were frozen and then reheated. No thanks...not coming back!!
Says the deliver on here but they don't when I call the guy was rude and hung up on me so I can't tell you how the food was, I ended up going somewhere else.
We have been coming here almost everyday during our stay at Vegas. Very nice buffet with lot of options for vegetarians

Having just got off the plane from LA and having not eaten for several hours, I was on the verge of passing out.  (Not really, but I was feeling pretty peckish.)  Jeff and I were driving towards the hotel, when I spotted Gandhi out of the corner of my eye.  Knowing that he likes India, having lived there for over a year, I thought he might like to try.  I am always willing to try a new Indian place.    I got a combination plate that had chicken tikka, some marinated chicken, kafta chopped up and a grilled shrimp.  The plate also came with some lentils, rice, raita, lettuce,paneer in a curry sauce and a curry with shrimp in it.    Jeff got a vegetarian plate that had the same rice, raita and lentils, but he also got a cauliflower dish (I don't remember the name) and some other curried vegetable.  He ate it all, so I know he liked it, but I don't think he loved it.    I loved pretty much everything I got, except the lentils. They needed something.  Salt?  The paneer was delicious.  It reminded me of the fresh cheese my grandmother used to make.  The shrimp curry was delicious, just the right amount of heat to it.  The raita was tasty.  The rice was nothing special.  I liked the naan.  I ate several pieces and I don't normally do that.    Jeff ordered a mango lassi.  He asked that they make it special with no milk, just yogurt.  They did that and he loved it.  He might have ordered another, if he weren't so full.    The service started off really well, but then it went downhill from there.  We got the food and then we never saw the waiters again. They were busy serving others.  So, we waited forever for the bill and a box to take home the leftovers.    The decor was kinda nice, kinda funky, kinda dark and kinda fashionable.  I liked certain parts of the restaurant, like the giant wooden Ganesh near the entrance.  The red on the walls was nice.  The paintings weren't anything special.  They turned up the lights for us, so we could read the menu. There were some special rooms that could be shut off with curtains.  I liked that touch.   I would definitely go back.  I wonder what the buffet would have been like, since we were there for dinner.

Hosted my Daughters BabyShower here and it was a success. Was able to go one day in advance and decorate a good size room and the staff was very helpful. The next day, which was the BabyShower,  we arrived early and again the staff was very helpful and The buffet was amazing.  The Guests keep raving how good the food was.  The manager Crystal was outstanding, took care of us personally and making sure all of our needs were met! Amazing service by her!
The food was excellent! It was the first time I had Indian Cuisine. I definitely will be come a regular at this restaurant.  Allison

Guys please AVOID this place at least for Buffet..!!!! I'm not allowed to give No rating else would have done that..  we just came back from Vegas & I couldn't stop myself from writing review for this place. Being an Indian knows how Indian food taste, smell,looks like. Believe me it was nothing like that. The menu was OK nothing fancy for the price you pay. Here is list of items in Vegetarian sect: Yellow daal  Rajma (any damn indian can make that better than what they had) Shahi Panner (tasted just like Heinz ketchup) Aloo Baigan (Big chunk of uncook potatoes) Naan (It took forever to get them, we told them 5 times that there is no naan & how are we supposed to eat all above items) Rice (we didnt cared about that as we left within 10 mins of our so called lunch Bufftet) Onion Pakora (Cold Pakora, have you ever ate one) Idli - (Hard as stone,  they made it 2 days ago to serve it. ) Sambhar (Sambhar was way tooo spicy & trust me when an Indian says too spicy it is...:)  The service is really really really bad. They dont care that you want something or not. They were behaving as if they are doing big favor on us by attending us. ohhh guys cmon .!!! Its one of the Buffet you never want to waste your money. Believe me.!!

Why was I surprised, after all this place has many two star review. I guess because I've eaten here before and thought the food was pretty good. But there's more to a restaurant than the quality of the food. So briefly here's my prob with this place.   First, they raise their prices when they feel it's appropriate - Christmas week. Yes, the week, not the day. How do you justify with no additional menu items? Next, Naan is part of the buffet and good but dry - most buffets serve fresh naan at the table. There was no patek paneer - I know, amazing huh? Finally, the plastic silverware was just too much. $15 buffet with plastic silverware!
The lunch buffet was delicious. All the dishes I sampled had great flavor and the spice level was not over the top. Great food, wonderful service ata reasonable price!
The server had a rude face . And gave bad service . He stand in the corner and uses his phone .   Will not return
What a hospitality, Awesome Food excellent Price affordable  Staff awesome I highly recommend to everyone to try food at Gandhi Indian Cuisine.

Went for the buffet. The price was$20 per person which was high, and the buffer did not really match up the standards of a $20 buffet!  Food quality was good and staff was fine, but just felt overpriced given what they had on offer

Alright, this is another place that you have to know how to do right.  I have been here for lunch and dinner, and lunch is totally the way to go.  They have a really tasty Indian buffet with lots of options.  I am not sure which ones are gluten-free, so the next time I go back to Vegas, I'll have more to report.  The service is alright.  I usually go thirsty for water.  Remember, your lassi is not included in the buffet price.  They do have large bus tours of people who come here en masse, so rub your rabbit's foot to make sure you don't show up at the same time.  Dinner is table service, which isn't the most awesome, and provides less value than the buffet.  Great vegetarian selections.  (Again, will update this again with GF facts.)  The best value for Indian food in Vegas.

Worst place to eat for any South Indian. Very expensive buffet($15) for all tasteless food. No salt (or) spices in chicken dishes, but 1&1 only item we liked is chicken tandoori. Don't walk in and expect biriyani r any south indian style food. Bad ambiance and time in filling buffet items. Strongly recommend to stay away from this place if you like to have tasty & and good South Indian buffet.
Love there food but it's been getting bad lately smaller selection and very watery the price is higher then most buffet in town hopefully they can get back on track

Very helpful! Amazing people... We were late they still let us in gave us what we asked for, and las but not the least called the cab for us which was late and they let us stand inside till the cab arrived. Unbelievably amazing food! The butter chicken is flawless... Perfect for people who like a little spice, but they make it without spice if you want them to. Literally Flawless.
Perfect end to the day! Just what you need after a tiring trip to Grand Canyon.. when burgers/ pizzas just wont cut it anymore.. go for the buffet, you wont regret it!

Great food, with knowledgeable and fun staff.   I felt very welcome and looked after by Paul, Gerard and Jaz!  I had the Chicken Biriyani, spiced to perfection and the naan bread was SO fresh!  Don't be deterred that is it is buried in a strip mall, it is a 'find'.   I am coming back with a big group of chaps next Jan. for the Consumer Electronics Show.   I don't write many reviews, but this place is special.

Great Food and service, a resident of Las Vegas for 18 years and always extremely satisfied with the food and service. Thank you Gandhi for being  consistently great!!  Anytime friends and family want Indian experience local and out of town I bring them to Gandhi
The food tasted amazing, and our server was great and efficient! Service was so speedy thanks to Crystal and Sudpal. We come here everytime we come to Vegas, and it gets better every time!

My wife and I have been coming to this restaraunt since 2009 for one very important reason.. they treat us like family.  We've experienced other Indian venues, but according to my taste buds, nothing compares.  The food is great if you are into strong herbs and spices.  I dont know what is in most dishes, but thats not important if the grub is smack good!  ...I know one of my faves is Chicken Masala. They have a selective buffet from 12pm - 2pm for $11.95 which is a great option for those who want to dib and dab here and there to see if this kind of cuisine is your thing.  The interior is exotic and the music is indian pop which all adds to the dining experience.  When you come in, ask for a server named  Megiddo, i swear he is Ghandi reincarnated!

Desperate for some Indian food, we were referred to Gandhi's India's Cuisine.  We arrived at 3:30 pm, only to discover they don't open for dinner on a Saturday until 5 pm.  As we debated whether it was worth waiting for, a couple of guys pulled up next to us and RAVED about place...saying "It's REALLY good...It's HELLA good..."  So, hearing this, we had to come back at 5 pm and so we did...what a mistake!  As we piled in at 5:30 pm, we looked around at the customers already seated. Lots of Indians were already dining and we took this as a good sign...and then we saw the buffet table set up.  Hmmm...we were hoping for an a la carte menu.  Unfortunately, they only had the buffet option available and so we were stuck with that.    We ordered Mango Lassi to drink and that was a highlight.  Then we all loaded up for the buffet line.  Gandhi's offers a mix of North and South Indian cuisines and I was disappointed with pretty much everything available.  I usually want Indian food when I desire lots of rich spices and tastes going on, and all th dishes simmering away lacked any full or individual flavors.  There was no spice, no heat, nothing that stood out! Blah!    They offered mint-cilantro sauce, but no pappadoms!  Argh.  I love pappadoms and they didn't have any!  I was already disappointed!  I love naan bread in general, but usually try the garlic or onion kinds, or whatever else is offered.  Not at this place, they just had plain naan bread that lacked any real flavor.  Everything had potatoes in it, too much potatoes if any.  One of my dining companions felt that she didn't eat her money's worth and went back for dessert - the mango/condensed milk dessert with fruit cocktail.  We all agreed that was the only thing worth eating there.  How sad is that?!  Sure...I ate...I was hungry.  It wasn't particularly good Indian food.  It was just that...food, and nothing else.  This restaurant was noted as award winning and "Best Ethnic Restaurant in Las Vegas" at one point.  I would assume they were a pretty decent Indian restaurant some time ago, but no longer.  I guess it's a sign when an Indian restaurant starts out with an a la carte menu, then ditches it completely to go for the buffet thing, it means hard times.  They are strapped and desperate for business.  Too bad I won't be that desperate enough to come here again unless I'm dragged.  Yeah, for the price of less than $17/pp, you get more bang for your buck this way, but that's not why I came to Gandhi's to eat.

I went here with a friend from Vegas on his reccomendation and at first was a little put off by the outside of the place as it didn't look so nice, but looks can be deceiving! The inside of Ghandi's is very nice, their service was prompt and their food was pretty good. Not the best indian I have ever had but definitely solid food. Next time I'm back in Vegas I would try soemthing different but I would not be afraid to return here.

Awesome place to eat. I love there food it is amazing and delicious. For Indian food these is the place to eat. There atmosphere is very nice and clean. There service is friendly and polite. I love there naan bread with Butter/chicken makhanwala, When we go here we always get the same items mixed vegetables, Tomato soup and My husband loves there Tandoori Chicken he says this place is the only place that knows how to make it the right way. We love this place and recommend it to all. One more thing you cant leave without trying there Kheer dessert its aaaamazing!
I came here for a early lunch. The place is a little dark inside. I had the buffet. The food was good. I would eat there again.

Very very poor service...waited for 30 minutes to be seated and finally got a smelly dirty table with no water no utensils .. Do not suggest this at all..food comes too late..others in d area are far better

Great food , avg. price. Spicy enough to stimulate your taste buds. Good service. Great  tomato soup , bhindi masala, chana masala , naan, jeera  rice , dal. Great interior. Location and view  from outside dose not reflect that this is located in Las Vegas.  Dull and dark from outside.  Definitely will go again.

Gandhi would have been ashamed of knowing what they have done to their name. Super super rude people. Come on a busy day and they would show you  how they care a fuck about their customers. They promised us a la carte ordering for dinner and a group of around 40 people showed up after us. They quickly changed their attitude and went ahead to actually fight with us. Food looked like it was lying around for more than an hour. And bathrooms super yucky. Thumbs down till they reach rock bottom.

This place is as good as the other Indian restaurants that I've been to in Las Vegas. The food is very good, the portions are still small, but if I go with someone else, I can usually finish their plates as well. One thing that stands out is the decor...It is beautiful. High ceilings, Indian nick-knacks hanging all over the place, linen table cloths, etc. The service is fast, and the prices are in-line with other Indian Restaurants in the area. I will go back if I'm ever on that side of town again.
Awesome food best indian food in Vegas I m coming from last 15 years.. Same taste & good service very friendly. I will recommend Gandhi for indian food..,
Came here twice in last 4 years. Made good Jain food for my parents and in laws when were in vegas on holiday.

This is a hidden jewel tucked away in a little strip mall about 10 min from the strip.  I was alone and interested in a combination plate.   I found one with an appetizer that looked like a main entree for two!   It was a delicious combination of grilled sausages, shrimp, tandoori chicken...it was fantastic.   The rest of the meal was equally as delicious.  And ended with a frozen mango dessert that was very simple but incredible.     I took half my meal home for tomorrow yet I'm stuffed!  The restaurants Decor is beautiful with many private dining cubbies for larger groups (of 6 plus)  The service was excellent and helpful and clearly commited to giving me a good experience.  I'm glad my yearning for an Indian experience pulled me away from the strip.  I located this place via Yelp and even discovered a small Yelp coupon (never seen one of those before)

After a long day of walking we decided to get some Indian food but was a huge let down. Located in a cheap strip mall, visit this place if you like to pay top dollars for bad quality food and below par customer service. The cheap plastic forks and spoons and the unfriendly behavior of the owner made our experience worse. This place is definitely not worth it's money.
Ordered malai kofta and Naan..kofta was harder than a rock..very poorly made..the gravy was just filled with turmeric..Naan very very oily and for the cost very very under whelming experience

This place is great! We come here all the time and the service is always amazing plus, the food is to die for! The chicken tiki masala is what I usually get and it has never disappointed me... Love this place!

Enjoyed a great dinner. Food was absolutely delicious. The decor of the restaurant is really cool. It took a little longer than most Indian restaurants to get our food. The people were very nice, but the service was a tiny bit lacking. I will be back.
Came here with a few friends mid afternoon, our server was Crystal who suggested some great food and was so helpful! Would love to come back again, great place and great cuisine.

Vegas is the land of the strip mall.  Seriously, outside of downtown, they're everywhere, and wedged in between all the nail salons and paycheck-advance stores, you can find some pretty good restaurants, if you don't mind the less-than-breathtaking surroundings.  Gandhi is a solid, reliable Indian restaurant that we've been going to for years.  The building is mysteriously huge, with super-high ceilings and a dining area that goes on for miles, but it does fill up at peak times on the weekends.  The decor is nothing fancy - bare white walls livened up with some wall hangings or framed pictures - but you're not there for the ambience, you're there for tons of spicy food.  When you sit down, they'll plop some pappadom down in front of you (those crunchy cracker-like flatbreads), plus a mint-cilantro sauce and a sweet-and-sour sauce.  I love this stuff, but be judicious in your use of the spicy sauce, because water service can be a bit slow here.  Everything here is good, especially the garlic naan.  The tandoori chicken is yummy, as is the rogan josh, palak paneer, and tikka masala.  Entrees range from $10--12, although they also have special tasting menus (including salad, rice, and dessert) that range from $15--22.  They have a lunch buffet on weekdays that's also an excellent value.  And there's a pretty good selection of beer and wine, including a few Indian beers, to go with your meal.  Nothing fancy decor- or ambience-wise, Gandhi nevertheless delivers good and reasonably priced Indian food in a quiet and pleasant setting.  If Vegas isn't already hot enough for you, spice it up with a trip to Gandhi.  And get the garlic naan!

What I remember most about Gandhi: the surprising interior and the tad expensive price tag on the lunch buffet (and my charming lunch companion). The buffet was large with plenty of vegetarian selections, and the food was good. I thought the flavors were tempting; they led me back for a second plate, but the vegetables were a tad overcooked, and hence, some things did not appear to be the freshest. Overall, I enjoyed my lunch, but when I find myself thinking about the interior and cost, I know that the food was not mind-blowingly delicious. At $12 the price is not the best value for Indian buffet, which is always a consideration for me. (The star rating is largely a reflection of the price.) Plus, since visiting Gandhi, I have revisited my go-to Indian buffet to confirm my taste buds preference.  The interior is quite impressive, a remodel since the days of the overhead carpet, and a stark contrast to the exterior surroundings. There are private rooms in the back, and I could see hosting a small private dinner here, as the restaurant feels spacious and nice.   However, this may be the last time I stray from my tried and true all time fave Indian buffet in Vegas, as I think my taste buds might run away if I try to take them anywhere else!

First impression, something smelled amazing and the place is absolutely cool. Makes you feel like you're inside an old Indian temple.. Very greatly decorated. We had an absolutely wonderful person serving us, Crystal. It was my first time eating Indian food and she was extremely patient and had excellent recommendations. Food was delicious. I went into this expecting not to like it and was so pleasantly surprised to find out, I actually quite liked it! Would recommend this place to anyone. P.S. The buttered chicken curry is literally heaven in your mouth. Enjoy!

Came for the lunch buffet and was not disappointed! Very good food at a great price and the staff was very friendly. The owner came and talked to us and asked how we liked everything. They're the first Indian restaurant in Las Vegas and they get people from all over the world that come based on word of mouth. Would highly recommend it to anyone!

12 of us of went here for dinner & Crystal served us by herself for the most part. We have several in our group who had never had Indian food. Crystal's patience in explaining dishes & making recommendations to those people was wonderful. She handled our large party with skill & efficiency. The food was outstanding. I plan to go back when I am in Las Vegas again! Between the excellent service & food it was an outstanding meal!

Bacchanal buffet my ass! Gandhi buffet it is!   The food tastes fresh, there is variety and its delicious!! What's not to like for a hungover group of 10 guys! I had a sampling of everything but stuck to my dal chaawal staple which was perfect for me. They have idli, sambhar and upma too for the average south Indian!   When a buffet costs $14-15, you would think they would invest in cutlery. Nope. although the plates are ceramic(very light), the cups are 'take-out' material cups and the spoons look metallic but they are 'faux' metal spoons. The fork bent while cutting into my idli, haha. Come on guys, invest a bit more.   Will be back.

Average food. Good, traditional and ethnic atmosphere. Buffet items are often cold and limited. Service is rude, unless you are an ethnic Indian. They often take your food away while you are still eating and do not like to answer questions. I prefer Tamba restaurant myself, which I hear is managed by same individuals. However, they just started managing this place, so maybe there are good things to come...we shall see.

Wow!  Just loved everything about this experience.  The food was very delicious, the waiters were constantly making sure we had enough water, were satisfied with our food, and were otherwise taken care of.  The decoration of the place is cool, too - definitely not what you'd expect looking at it from the outside.  And, for all you vegetarians/vegans, there's plenty to eat here - and though I can't remember what dish I had (the waiter picked it out for me), it was SO good!  Definitely a spot I'll come back to.

I was visiting from California and was looking for some good Indian food. There were several in the area but we choose Ghandi's. I had the goat curry with rice and naan. Overall it was good. Not the best and definitely not the worst. The staff was friendly enough and I liked the restaurant and the atmosphere.

This was my first Indian restaurant, honestly I'm not a big fan of spicy food. This is the reason I'm giving it 4 stars. Decoration was beautiful, and our waiter was very hospitable. He assisted my friends and I to understand the menu and select our dishes. Unfortunately, spicy food isn't my thing but my friends sure did enjoy their food. If you love spicy, this is definitely the place for you.

This was the best indian restaurant my parents liked. They r vegeterrian and were happy to see lot of veggi options ... Their food is like home and desserts (sevayian kheer) was awesome. I absolutely recommend brunch buffet. Good north-indian lunch and south indian breakfast. Overall a good place to have a brunch. +1 for Gandhi
5 star for Crystal. Very good service and really kind. We enjoyed the food and service. We'll comeback for sure.

Typing while I am eating here. My service has been very good. Attentive , friendly, and polite staff is very welcoming upon arrival. The mint chutney is very good and a little spicy but I love hot food. My naan is over cooked and a little dry. The chicken vindaloo is exquisite . One of the better versions I have had. If you ask for hot, it is HOT. Be careful what level of spice you ask for. It is a really great place to eat. I give it 3.5 stars because of the naan.

I try to find an Indian restaurant in almost every city I visit because I love it so.  I've made three visits to Gandhi's while in Vegas and every time have had an excellent meal with great service.     I've even visited the lunch buffet.  Lunch buffets can be mediocre and are often bland, but not at Gandhi's.  good stuff.

The buffet is ok here.  I actually enjoyed dinner much more.  I got one of the tandoori sets which was pretty good.  I'd rather go to other places for an Indian lunch buffet.  But the atmosphere is kinda "eh" here compared to some of the other places around which is why this wouldn't be my first choice.
Regulation Indian restaurant in the USA. Watered down food for the most part. But not bad.

I ate here recently & I must say I almost shed a tear. My taste buds had never taste something so delicious lol ok, maybe I'm over doing it a little, but seriously it was my first time having Indian food and I must say it was amazing. Although the selection wasnt very much, what they offered was so good it didn't even matter. My favorite was the grilled chicken. Not only is the food tasty, but the environment is so relaxing and the workers are very polite. I definitely recommend this place. Yu won't be disappointed.

My favorite restaurant in Las Vegas (with all due respect to the many excellent places that I haven't eaten). The Bombay thali was superior (I should have ordered two!) Wonderful ambiance, attentive servers, and a lunch buffet!

This is our favorite Indian restaurant! Good food, caring service, they once fed us after they were closed, we knocked on door, and we explained that we were tired and hungry and had driven 6 hrs to get to Gandhi, they fed us a great dinner! We are big fans! And always eat one meal here , when we visit Vegas.
This restaurant felt like home. I loved the seasoning and the flavors! The staff was so nice and kind and really took care of us. I will go back!
Crystal is awesome we ordered Gandhi thali is was the best she was very attentive and i will be be back definitely!!!!!

Great & friendly service but wow, the food was spectacular. The restaurant is also beautifully & authentically decorated on the inside. Apparently this is the very first Indian restaurant opened in LV!... definitely lives up to that.
Really good lunch buffet!   (ends at 1pm, so go before!) Slightly different choices depending upon the day... Definitely one of the best Indian food spots in town.

Best Indian buffet in Las Vegas  I am pure non vegetarian & my wife is vegetarian. And we visit Vegas several times every year since last 17 years. I have dined at many desi restaurants here. This is my second review of Gandhi. Last time I gave a 3 star not because their food was not good but because of other reasons. but now they deserve better rating. The lamb curry is fantastic (my all time favorite) & so was the chicken tikka masala.  My wife loves the malai kofta & so did I. We love their rice & dal fry too. And no, they don't use plastic ware or paper cups for buffet anymore. I have dined in many Indian restaurants all throughout the US & I think Gandhi is one of my favorite North Indian restaurant. Their Indian buffet definitely ranks in top 3 in the US. Good job team!!

Truly disappointing lunch buffet. I've been to Gandhi a few times and its been pretty good. This is the first time I tried the lunch buffet and, the fact that I felt compelled to leave a review, should be an indicator of how I felt my meal went. First of all, no one at the front when I came in, i came in and looked at the buffet line and then waited for roughly 2-3 minutes to even see an employee, they finally sat me and I got my first round of food. The tandoori chicken was nearly cold and hard as a rock, the side that was on the chafing dish was charred to a crisp (not always a bad thing). I informed the young waiter that the tandoori chicken was cold, he went and took the temperature of the chicken, said something to his, what looked to be his boss, then closed the lid. Clearly it was under temperature and he tried to reheat it in this way... huge health hazard that could get them closed in of itself. No biryani, only 3 meat dishes and all were chicken, no naan or rice on the buffet line so it had to be brought out which seemed to be difficult to even find someone to help. My drink remained empty for the majority of my meal even though a waiter kept walking by. I finally asked for a refill and it took him about 8 minutes to bring me my refill. Sweet rice for dessert? what the hell is that? Literally their basmati rice that they serve to everyone, mixed with milk and sugar. It was disgusting and the rice was under cooked. I'm Indian... I have never heard of this recipe before.... for 11.95... its a rip off. Enjoy GOOD indian food and drive a block up to Delhi Indian Cuisine.
Pathetic service , rude behavior , asking kid not to make a mess . I suggest everyone just ignore this and try a another one.
Awesome Indian food! Tried everything in Vegas but no match..... Must try.... Make sure you try mango kulfi

Please AVOID this place !! If given an option I will give 0 stars  When we walked in, we were told they dont serve ala carte items and only buffet option. But what they didnt tell us was, they wont refill the buffet items. Whatever items we asked, they said its over and not be refilled. The tandoori chicken was too unflavourful and tasted. None of the Paneer dishes had paneer. Idli was too hard and made days ago. They just heated the frozen idlis and served them. The only thing they refilled was plain rice and Naan. Desserts were also bad.  The service is ok but not great. But definitely not worth the price you pay for the buffet.

Solid value in the all you can eat lunch buffet. Carb overload usually sets in 30 minutes later but worth it. The service is okay the decor works. They could turn down the music a little. It felt a little cluby during the day. They have a chutney with olives that I put on most everything. It's spicy and bitter at the same time but I like it. All of the dishes are prepared with quality in mind. This Yelper likes the $11 lunch!!
Food is delicious. However, entr√©e is $15 and you have to pay extra for sides ( rice). I guess that's fine but you have to warn people of that in the menu. Driver did not speak English.

The food is great, the dal makani is awesome.  I was there for thanksgiving dinner and they ran the buffet all day long and into dinner which was cool, but thw service is atrocious.  I was never even offered anything other than water while I watched other tables being attended to well.  Maybe a single ABCD isn't a valued guest.

Okay, so I'll be honest, I have not eaten at a whole bunch of other Indian restaurants.  That being said, the lunch buffet is absolutely delicious.  I am relatively new to Indian food, and my friend told me I had to try this hidden gem.    The restaurant itself is squeezed behind an Albertsons (next to a wig shop) but don't let that deter you!  Inside is very nice, and open.  Everything I had on the buffet was delicious (and I tried a little bit of almost everything!) and the servers kept our water glasses full and our table clear of abandoned plates.  I would definitely recommend this to others, and I will return (if only for the tikka masala...omg so delicious).  My friend told me that regionally, this restaurant favored the northern styles of cooking and most of the others nearby are more southern in orientation.  So keep that in mind if this is not entirely what you expected.  I found everything to be delicious.  I've been stuffed for hours. Give it a shot.  :)

I have been coming to this restaurant for more than 7 years, and no other restaurant compares to it. The customer service is excellent and they go above and beyond to make sure you have a great experience.  Food is fresh with real authentic Indian flavors. The buffet offers great variety at a great price. I take family and coworkers here whenever possible. Great ambience, food, and customer service all at a great price.Try Gandhi you won't be disappointed.
I love this place I have been dining here for years the food is awesome the service is excellent the atmosphere pleasing I highly recommend the Gandhi thali sampler platter and lunch buffet
I ate at ghandi on paradise for the lunch buffet recently, the food was decent, cost was 10$ nothing amazing.
Awesome.  Great food & service. We'll be back very soon.  Tikka Masala is one of the best I've had.
Run down restaurant with okay food but exceptionally ride management and staff, won't be returning here and can't recommend this place to anyone anymore.

Ridiculous. Utterly ridiculous. I just called and attempted to place an order by telephone. I was promptly asked to call back in 45 minutes! What kind of business asks a potential customer to call back??! I apologized for bothering them and informed them that I wouldn't be giving them my business. Sorry about it.

The place is loc in the middle of a shady strip mall.  We got there and it LOOKS elegant from the inside, but dont be fooled.  The waiter took forever to take our order and took forever to bring us our food, - so Poor service.  The food was so bland and non tasty.  I ordered the meat Thali and it wasnt good at all.  Might as well have starved.  and on top of that it was crazy expensive.  like 15-18 dollar per plate.  I dont wanna pay that much and get nothing back in return.  Im Indian - take it from me - this place SUCKS.

Although the outside is not spectacular, I was impressed with their set up and buffet service. I was feeling the mood, the music, the food aroma, the curtains, etc. It was a nice place and our waiter was very attentive and funny. The food was delicious and I thoroughly enjoyed every dish. Mango Lassi was to die for. Overall, lunch buffet price is within inexpensive-affordable. I will be sure to make a trip here whenever I go to Vegas!!
